title: Bride and Prejudice star Tori's posh mother Mary-Ann gives a cold response to pregnancy news
text:
The Bride and Prejudice couple confirmed their happy pregnancy news last week.

And on Tuesday night's episode, James and Tori were seen breaking the news to their harshest critic - Tori's posh mother, Mary-Ann.

Admitting the news 'shocked' her, Mary-Ann didn't give the warmest reaction to the announcement, saying: 'Am I hearing something, or is it true?'

'You've shocked me': Bride and Prejudice star Tori's posh mother Mary-Ann (pictured) didn't give the warmest reaction to her daughter's pregnancy news on the show on Tuesday

'It's very early days though,' James responded. 'We haven't actually told anyone, you're the first, in regards to my family...'

Mary-Ann had previously accused tradie James of being disrespectful and urged Tori to marry a more 'professional' man instead, while Tori has claimed that Mary-Ann was a 'cruel' mother who never showed her love as a child.

Remaining motionless at James' response, Mary-Ann looked to the floor before saying: 'That's lovely.'

Baby news! Tori (left) confirmed the happy baby news to her posh mother on Tuesday night's episode

'So you had no idea? You had no inkling?' she asked, before learning the pair were five to six weeks into their pregnancy.

Mary-Ann continued: 'Well you've shocked me a bit, I'm a bit speechless.'

'As long as you both are happy. Congratulations.'

Not impressed: Mary-Ann had previously accused tradie James of being disrespectful and urged Tori to marry a more 'professional' man instead

Speaking to the camera, Mary-Ann added: 'I was not expecting that announcement at all, no.'

Speaking to her daughter, she warned: 'I'd be very, very careful, of the next 12 weeks.'

'She'll be fine,' Tori replied, to which Mary-Ann said: 'That's your answer to everything. I hope it doesn't backfire. Exciting times.'

Bride and Prejudice continues Monday at 7:30pm on Channel Seven.

authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
